title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 28
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 28:

We have 35 titles here:

-  Ahram - Proxy Warriors; the Rise and Fall of State-Sponsored Militias (2011)

-  Aksan & Bailes - Weapon of the Strong; Conversations on US State Terrorism (2013)

-  Assange - The WikiLeaks Files; the World According to US Empire (2015)

-  Assange - When Google Met WikiLeaks (2014)

-  Bass - The Blood Telegram; Nixon, Kissinger, and a Forgotten Genocide (2013)

-  Brigham - Iraq, Vietnam, and the Limits of American Power (2008)

-  Burlingame - Controversy! Government Entitlements (2012)

-  Byrne - Iran-Contra; Reagan's Scandal and the Unchecked Abuse of Presidential Power (2014)

-  Callanan - Covert Action in the Cold War; US Policy, Intelligence and CIA Operations  (2010)

-  Chomsky - Acts of Aggression; Policing Rogue States (1999)

-  Chomsky - Power and Terror; Conflict, Hegemony, and the Rule of Force, 2e (2011)

-  Cockburn - Kill Chain; the Rise of High-Tech Assassins (2015)

-  Cockburn & St. Clair - Whiteout; the CIA, Drugs and the Press (1999)

-  Conway-Lanz - Collateral Damage ; Americans, Noncombatant Immunity, and Atrocity after World War II (2006)

-  Crawford - Accountability for Killing; Moral Responsibility for Collateral Damage in America's Post 9-11 Wars (2013)

-  Emerson - Secret Warriors; Inside the Covert Military Operations of the Reagan Era (1988)

-  Engelhardt - Shadow Government; Surveillance, Secret Wars, and a Global Security State in a Single-Superpower World (2014)

-  Giblin - The Rise and Fall of Senator Joe McCarthy (2009)

-  Gobat - Confronting the American Dream; Nicaragua Under U.S. Imperial Rule (2005)

-  Hendricks - A Kidnapping in Milan; the CIA on Trial (2010)

-  Jones et al - Securing Tyrants or Fostering Reform; U.S. Internal Security Assistance to Repressive and Transitioning Regimes (2006)

-  McCoy - Torture and Impunity; the U.S. Doctrine of Coercive Interrogation (2013)

-  McGehee - Deadly Deceits; My 25 Years in the CIA (1983)

-  Priest & Arkin - Top Secret America; the Rise of the New American Security State (2011)

-  Rauch - Kindly Inquisitors; the New Attacks on Free Thought (2013)

-  Risen - Pay Any Price; Greed, Power, and Endless War (2014)

-  Schiemann - Does Torture Work (2016)

-  Shane - Objective Troy; a Terrorist, a President, and the Rise of the Drone (2015)

-  Smith-Cannoy - Insincere Commitments; Human Rights Treaties, Abusive States, and Citizen Activism (2012)

-  Spence - Police State; How America's Cops Get Away with Murder (2015)

-  The Senate Intelligence Committee Report on Torture (2014)

-  Trabue - A Life of Lies and Spies; Tales of a CIA Ops Polygraph Interrogator (2015)

-  Urwin - The Sixteen; the Sensational Story of Britain's Top-Secret Military Assassination Squad, 2e (2015)

-  Whitehead - A Government of Wolves, the Emerging American Police State (2013)
